["Sky News created nine new X user accounts emulating different British political leanings to audit the platform's algorithm.", "Sky News collected posts from the users' For You pages twice daily for two weeks to build a dataset of around 90,000 posts for analysis.", 'Sky News worked with independent academics and researchers, including Dr Jen Golbeck, to categorise the political leanings of around 6,000 accounts whose posts appeared in their dataset.', 'Sky News used a Large Language Model to categorise content as part of their analysis.', 'An X spokesperson told Sky News that the algorithm will soon be fully AI-powered and that X will open source the algorithm every two weeks or so.', "An X spokesperson told Sky News that by December users will be able to adjust their feeds dynamically by asking X's AI tool Grok.", "X posted the algorithm's code to GitHub in 2023 and last updated it in September 2025.", 'X replaced the former curation team with tools like Community Notes where users add context to flagged posts to support the safety team in combating misinformation.', 'Ofcom has enforced the Online Safety Act since March, giving the regulator powers to compel platforms to act against illegal material.', 'Ofcom has required platforms to implement age verification measures since July.', "In response to Sky News' reporting, Ofcom stated that the Online Safety Act does not require platforms to ensure political balance in what is posted on their platforms.", "In response to Sky News' reporting, Ofcom stated that in due course some of the most widely-used sites and apps will be subject to additional duties under the Act, including protecting content of democratic importance."]

['OpenAI improved how the ChatGPT chatbot responds when people are in distress.', "OpenAI expanded ChatGPT's referrals to professional help.", "OpenAI's support team said the conversation would be investigated as an urgent safety review.", 'OpenAI previously trained ChatGPT to direct people to seek professional help.', 'OpenAI said it was continuing to evolve ChatGPT with input from experts from around the world.', "OpenAI's support team told Viktoria's mother that the messages were 'absolutely unacceptable' and a 'violation' of its safety standards.", 'Character.AI announced it would ban under-18s from talking to its AI chatbots.', 'Character.AI said it continues to evolve its safety features.', "Character.AI offered its deepest sympathies to Juliana's family.", 'Viktoria agreed to see a psychiatrist after showing the conversation to her mother.', 'Viktoria is now receiving medical help.', "Juliana's mother spent months examining her daughter's phone for answers after her death."]

['In July 2022, the United Network for Organ Sharing (UNOS) prohibited transplant hospitals from using race-based eGFR calculations.', 'In January 2023, UNOS required all transplant programs to review their waiting lists and modify the wait time for Black patients affected by the race-based eGFR.', 'The hospital credited Jazmin Evans with extra years of wait time, raising her total time on the transplant waitlist to about eight years.', 'Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center dropped the eGFR race correction in 2017.', 'Multiple hospitals removed the race-based eGFR modifier shortly after the 2020 paper addressing race corrections was published.', 'The National Kidney Foundation and the American Society of Nephrology Task Force recommended removing race from eGFR calculations.', 'The Coalition to End Racism and Clinical Algorithms (CERCA) formed to accelerate changes to race-based clinical algorithms.', 'A race-free version of the vaginal birth after cesarean calculator has been made available since 2021.', 'The American Thoracic Society endorsed a race-free lung function equation known as GLI-Global.', 'Jefferson University Hospital and Jefferson Einstein Hospital adjusted the accrued wait time for 405 patients.', 'As a result of the credited wait time adjustments at Jefferson, 122 patients received kidney transplants sooner.', 'The Medical University of South Carolina informed Craig Merritt that his credited wait time had doubled.', 'The New York City Board of Health declared racism a public health crisis.']

['LinkedIn updated its terms of service.', 'LinkedIn informed Ireland’s Data Protection Commission that clarifications to its global privacy policy would be issued.', 'LinkedIn said the updated global privacy policy would include an opt-out setting for members who do not want their data used to train content-generating AI models.', 'LinkedIn provided an opt-out toggle in the Data Privacy settings to disable use of a member’s data for training content-creation AI models.', 'LinkedIn offered a more comprehensive opt-out via a dedicated form while noting that opt-outs would not affect training that had already taken place.', 'LinkedIn told TechCrunch it uses privacy-enhancing techniques, including redacting and removing information, to limit personal information in datasets used for generative AI training.', 'The Open Rights Group called on the UK Information Commissioner’s Office to investigate LinkedIn and other social networks that train on user data by default.', 'Meta worked with the UK Information Commissioner’s Office to simplify the opt-out process before resuming plans to scrape user data for AI training.']

["CDT released the report 'Generating Confusion: Stress-Testing AI Chatbots on Voting with a Disability'.", 'To create the report, CDT tested five chatbots (Mixtral 8x7B v0.1, Gemini 1.5 Pro, ChatGPT-4, Claude 3 Opus and Llama 2 70b) to examine election-related misinformation impacts on people with disabilities.', 'CDT has been working with the federal government to ensure that, as AI advances, governments consider the potential impact on people with disabilities.', 'The report recommended that people avoid using AI chatbots as a primary source for election information.', 'The report suggested that people use AI chatbots to find more reliable resources rather than as a primary source for election information.', 'The report recommended that users fact-check chatbot-provided information using trusted sources before sharing or relying on it.', 'The report recommended that developers direct users to authoritative sources of election information.', 'The report recommended that developers prohibit acts by their systems that could potentially interfere with elections.', 'The report suggested that developers test the model by posing common election questions.', "The report suggested that developers disclose how recently the model's training data was updated."]

["Spinvox issued a public statement calling the BBC's claims incorrect and inaccurate.", 'Spinvox spoke several times to the BBC about its technology.', 'Spinvox stated that parts of messages sent to conversion experts are anonymised so there is no way of tracing them back to a particular number or person.', 'Spinvox stated that its human-mediated training of the speech system was accomplished in total security through anonymisation, encryption and randomisation.', 'Spinvox stated that the Egyptian call centre did not meet its stringent standards and never handled live calls.', "The Information Commissioner's Office contacted Spinvox to ensure that its entry on the data protection register is accurate and complete, especially regarding transfer of personal data outside the European Economic Area.", "Spinvox's co-founder appealed to staff to take all or part of their pay for July and August in the form of share options to help raise £1m."]

["Each AI-generated article was labeled with a statement that it was generated by Cosmos's custom AI service.", 'Cosmos had all generated content fact-checked by a trained science communicator.', 'Cosmos had all generated content edited by its publishing team.', "CSIRO Publishing issued a statement dismissing concerns that the experiment involved training OpenAI's GPT-4 model on Cosmos contributors' articles.", 'CSIRO Publishing placed the AI experiment under continual review.', 'CSIRO Publishing said the review could involve testing changes to how the AI tool is programmed.', 'CSIRO Publishing said the review could involve testing changes to how the AI tool is used.', 'CSIRO Publishing said the review could determine whether further usage or development of the tool will continue after the end of the project.', 'Cosmos has not published any AI-generated articles since the end of July.', "Cosmos's acting editor referred media questions about the project to CSIRO Publishing.", 'The Walkley Foundation said it is in ongoing conversation with CSIRO about the project.', 'The Walkley Foundation said it will monitor compliance of the Meta Australian News Fund grant until its conclusion in February 2025.', 'CSIRO assured the Walkley Foundation that it will honour and pay copyright holders as required.', 'The news story was updated to reflect an additional statement from the Walkley Foundation.']

['The Cook County State’s Attorney’s office withdrew all ShotSpotter evidence against Michael Williams.', "A ShotSpotter analyst manually overrode the system's algorithms and reclassified the 11:46 p.m. sound as a gunshot.", 'ShotSpotter issued a forensic report that included a map and GPS coordinates and updated the address to be closer to the originally identified GPS coordinates.', 'Rochester police contacted ShotSpotter requesting additional analysis, after which a ShotSpotter analyst concluded there had been four gunshots.', 'After Chicago police contacted ShotSpotter following the Godinez incident, a ShotSpotter analyst reanalyzed the audio files and identified five additional gunshots.', "A jury acquitted Silvon Simmons of attempted murder, and a judge overturned his conviction for possession of a gun, citing ShotSpotter's unreliability.", 'Several customers dropped ShotSpotter, citing too many false alarms and a lack of return on investment.', 'Community and civil rights groups in Chicago launched a campaign calling on city officials to drop ShotSpotter.', 'ShotSpotter representatives publicly defended and disputed criticisms of their technology in communications with Motherboard.']

["Prosecutors requested dismissal of Michael Williams' case, saying they had insufficient evidence.", 'A judge dismissed the case against Michael Williams at the request of prosecutors.', "Williams' attorney subpoenaed ShotSpotter for the company’s correspondence with state’s attorneys.", 'The judge agreed to schedule a hearing about whether to release ShotSpotter’s operating protocol and other documents the company wants to keep secret.', 'ShotSpotter provided The Associated Press with a copy of the full real-time alert related to the Chicago incident.', 'ShotSpotter provided The Associated Press with additional court records showing that a judge later reconsidered admissibility of ShotSpotter evidence in a prior case.', 'ShotSpotter provided statements in response to questions submitted by The Associated Press for the article.', 'Cities including Charlotte and San Antonio ended their ShotSpotter contracts after false alerts and lack of alerts.', 'In Fall River, Massachusetts, ShotSpotter turned off its system after it reportedly worked less than 50% of the time and missed all seven shots in a downtown murder.', 'The Fresno public school district ended its ShotSpotter contract after finding it too costly and amid community concerns.', 'Judges in a number of cases have thrown out or excluded ShotSpotter evidence.']

["In June 2022, ShotSpotter stopped showing the algorithm's confidence rating to human reviewers.", 'ShotSpotter issued a statement to the Associated Press asserting that the human review process provides a positive check on the algorithm.', 'ShotSpotter argued in court for more than a year that the operations document was a trade secret.', 'The operations document was released from a protective order in a Chicago court case.', 'A judge dismissed the murder case against Michael Williams due to insufficient evidence.', 'ShotSpotter told the Associated Press that it has other comprehensive training and operational materials that it is keeping confidential as trade secrets.']

['Staff at the preprint server Preprints.org pulled down the article after learning of the fake references.', "The preprint server blacklisted the manuscript's authors.", "MDPI's journal Insects rejected the manuscript.", "The preprint's corresponding author, Kahsay Tadesse Mawcha, admitted to using ChatGPT to produce the manuscript.", 'Mawcha posted an updated version of the paper to the preprint server Research Square.', 'Mawcha deleted the made-up papers by Enghoff from the reference list of the revised preprint.', "Research Square's editorial team said it would look into the case and take appropriate action on the preprint.", "After being contacted by Retraction Watch, Research Square removed all mention of the International Journal of Tropical Insect Science from the manuscript's webpage.", 'The editors of the International Journal of Tropical Insect Science said they were aware of the issues and were handling the case accordingly.', 'Carlos Martínez emailed Mawcha asking him to stop trying to publish his AI-generated manuscript.', 'Carlos Martínez contacted the International Journal of Tropical Insect Science about the manuscript.', 'Carlos Martínez contacted the African Association of Insect Scientists about the manuscript.', "Carlos Martínez contacted Ethiopia's embassy in Germany about the manuscript.", 'Research Square said it was manually reviewing submissions while its retraction alert feature was under repair.', 'Retraction Watch contacted Research Square about the manuscript.']

['Robert Kneschke contacted LAION in February to request that his images be removed from the training dataset.', "LAION's law firm Heidrich Rechtsanwälte sent a letter stating LAION was compliant with copyright laws and that it was not possible to remove Kneschke's images because the organization does not store copies.", 'The law firm threatened to collect claims for damages from Kneschke for filing an unjustified copyright claim.', 'The legal letter included an invoice for €979 and demanded that Kneschke pay the amount within 14 days or face legal action.', "At the end of March, Kneschke sent a cease-and-desist request asking LAION to remove his images and to provide information on the extent, duration, and sources of the dataset's use of his works.", "LAION's lawyers responded that there had been no copyright infringement and that any reproductions were temporary and covered by Sections 44b and 60d of the UrhG.", "LAION's lawyers further stated that LAION did not store copies of Kneschke's works that could be deleted or about which information could be provided.", 'Kneschke filed a lawsuit against LAION at the Hamburg regional court.', "Getty is suing Stability AI for its role in supporting the development of LAION, including the use of Getty Images' photographs.", 'Karla Ortiz launched a fundraising campaign to hire a lobbyist in Washington D.C. to seek changes to US copyright, data privacy, and labor laws to protect artists.', 'Stability AI announced in December that it would honor all opt-out requests collected from the Have I Been Trained? website.', "LAION's website FAQ states that EU citizens who find their images or identifiable data in the dataset are eligible to file a GDPR claim to have their personal data taken down."]

["The researchers shared a preprint paper describing the 'fox8' Twitter botnet.", "They used Twitter's API to collect tweets and accounts for analysis.", "They searched Twitter for the phrase 'as an ai language model' over the six-month period between October 2022 and April 2023 to identify likely LLM-powered accounts.", "They searched for 'self revealing' text that may have been posted accidentally by LLM-powered bots to discover candidate accounts.", "They applied LLM-detection tools, including OpenAI's detector and GPTZero, to the botnet's tweet corpus to assess whether the content was machine-generated.", 'They analyzed account behaviors and found a single probabilistic model governing activity types and frequencies, suggesting behavioral-pattern analysis as a detection method.', 'They analyzed relationships among the collected accounts and determined the fox8 network appeared to promote three news websites likely controlled by the same anonymous owner.']

['The Spanish Data Protection Agency (AEPD) opened an administrative file (expediente) against Plastic Forte.', 'The AEPD fined Plastic Forte 20,000 euros for photographing employees and creating biometric templates without informing them.', 'Plastic Forte recognized its responsibility in the AEPD proceeding.', 'Plastic Forte renounced submitting allegations in the AEPD proceeding.', "The AEPD reduced the fine by 20% as a consequence of Plastic Forte's recognition of responsibility and renunciation of allegations.", 'Plastic Forte made a prompt payment of the sanction.', 'The AEPD granted an additional 20% reduction of the fine due to the prompt payment, leaving the sanction at 12,000 euros.', 'The AEPD fined another company 5,000 euros for installing a video surveillance system that captured audio without informing workers or customers.', 'In its resolution the AEPD reminded that the use of facial recognition requires a data protection impact assessment and communication to the works council about how, when, and who deploys the biometric technology.', "The AEPD's resolution specified that the required impact assessment must include an analysis of the necessity and proportionality of the system and the measures planned to address risks such as security breaches and the transfer of biometric information to less secure centralized databases.", "The AEPD's resolution advised that, if facial recognition is implemented, the amount of facial data collected should be minimized and the biometric template size should be balanced to manage security and reconstruction risks."]
